trial_identification.studytitle: Performance evaluation of cosmetic contact lenses - a useability study
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Performance evaluation of cosmetic contact lenses as rated by healthy individuals in a two-week daily wear trial

conditions.healthcondition: Desire to alter or enhance eye colour

interventions.interventions: Cosmetic (eye colour-changing) contact lenses worn for a minimum of 4 hours per day for 10 days out of a 14 day period

primaryOutcome.outcome: Ease of handling, assessed by questionnaire
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Daily until end of observation (14 days)
Daily until end of observation (14 days)
Daily until end of observation (14 days)

secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Daily until end of observation (14 days)

eligibility.exclusivecriteria: No history or signs of ocular infection or trauma, no history of ocular surgery, no topical ocular medications

secondarysponsor.sponsoraddress:
Level 10, UniServices House, 70 Symonds Street, Auckland
Private Bag, 92019 AMC, Auckland 1142, New Zealand

ethicsAndSummary.summary: As a measure of potential acceptibility of this product by the NZ market, a performance evaluation study of a cosmetic contact lens, from the lens wearers perspective, is being conducted. With the use of questionnaires, the study will evaluate ease of handling during insertion, removal and cleaning, lens comfort, and satisfaction with appearance and visual performance.

ethicscommitee.ethicname: University of Auckland Human Participants Ethics Committee
